intro: Hilsenbergia lyciacea, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of bright red, tubular flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological importance. Hilsenbergia lyciacea is also valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance in landscaping.
